TextView.android:text: This is today's Loving-Kindness meditation exercise:

1. Choose a quiet and comfortable space where you can sit or lie down without distractions. Sit in a comfortable position with your back straight but relaxed. You can sit cross-legged on the floor, on a cushion, or in a chair with your feet flat on the ground.

2. Gently close your eyes to help minimize external distractions and turn your attention inward. Take a few deep breaths to relax your body and calm your mind. Allow any tension or stress to melt away with each exhale.

3. Start by directing loving-kindness towards yourself. Repeat phrases such as 'May I be happy, may I be healthy, may I be safe, may I be at ease.' Repeat these phrases silently to yourself or say them aloud, whichever feels most comfortable for you.

4. Once you feel a sense of warmth and compassion towards yourself, gradually extend loving-kindness to others. You can start by focusing on loved ones, such as family members, friends, or mentors. Repeat the same phrases for them: 'May [person's name] be happy, may [person's name] be healthy, may [person's name] be safe, may [person's name] be at ease.'
5. In the final stage of the meditation, extend loving-kindness to all beings without exception. Even to difficult individuals-people with whom you may have challenges or conflicts.
6. When you're ready, gently bring your awareness back to the present moment. Wiggle your fingers and toes, stretch your body, and open your eyes slowly.
